key_title: Key to the genera of Orchidaceae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the families in the Asparagales-Liliales complex

leads.lead_text: Plants terrestrial (rarely on tree-fern trunks), above-ground parts usually annual; leaves often membranous
Plants epiphytic or lithophytic, perennial; leaves rather tough
Labellum above the column in mature flowers (non-resupinate)
Labellum below the column in mature flowers (resupinate)
Labellum on a movable, slender, strap-like claw (articulate on column-foot), lamina attached by lower surface (not margin)
Labellum claw very short and inconspicuous, lamina attached by margin
Leaves absent; column with wing-like auricles above the middle; labellum lamina narrow, fringed with hairs
Leaves present, often reddish; column broadly winged for its entire length; labellum lamina ovate to ovoid, lacking marginal hairs
[link through]
Labellum more than 1.5 cm long, much larger and broader than all other segments; leaves ovate to elliptic or absent
Labellum less than 1.5 cm long, about as long as other segments; leaf tubular and stem-encircling for much of its length or absent
Leaves absent; flowers pendent on a distinct pedicel, brown and white, bell-like with all segments fused in basal half
Leaf present; flowers not pendant, more or less sessile, variously coloured, at least some perianth segments totally free
Perianth segments usually < 7 mm long; leaf sheath opening into lamina near to base of inflorescence; labellum on a movable claw; flowers mainly autumn
Perianth segments usually > 7mm long; leaf sheath opening into lamina well below inflorescence; labellum not on a movable claw; flowers mainly spring
Perianth segments less than 5 mm long
Perianth segments more than 5 mm long
Leaf solitary, round in cross-section, surrounding much of scape
Leaves several, linear, mostly free from scape
Dorsal sepal with a prominent backward-pointing spur at base; flowers arranged in an indistinct spiral, mostly reddish-brown and yellow
Dorsal sepal without a spur at base; flowers usually arranged in a distinct spiral, pink with a white labellum, rarely all white

Flowers green or reddish with colourless 'windows'; dorsal sepal and petals adhering for their entire length forming a galea; labellum small and mobile; leaves usually several per plant, sometimes withered at flowering
Combination of characters not as above
Flowers usually entirely reddish or purplish; dorsal sepal and immobile labellum enlarged and more or less cohering; other perianth segments minute; leaf solitary
Combination of characters not as above
Perianth almost actinomorphic; labellum very similar to all other perianth segments
Perianth zygomorphic; labellum usually much modified and different from other perianth segments
Lateral sepals either much larger or much narrower than dorsal sepal
Lateral sepals not markedly different in shape and length from dorsal sepal
Lateral sepals much larger than all other segments, white or pink; labellum much recurved in distal half
Lateral sepals much narrower and longer than dorsal sepal, brown or greenish; labellum not recurved in distal half
Leaf solitary (rarely 2), ovate; labellum with wide, reddish-purple fringe
Leaves 2 or more, linear; labellum-margins entire
[link through]
Petals large and well-developed, pedicellate; lateral sepals deflexed, narrow; flowers pedicellate
Petals minute, sessile, erect or upcurved, hidden within the dorsal sepal; lateral sepals erect, extremely long and thread-like; flowers sub-sessile
[link through]
Labellum longer than all other segments, densely covered with brown to reddish-hairs or papillae (except in C. imberbis)
Labellum no longer than other segments, usually shorter, indumentum not as above
Plants with basal leaves or large leafy bracts at some stage of development
Plants lacking basal leaves and large cauline leafy bracts at all stages of development, basal bracts sometimes present
Leaf solitary; labellum entirely smooth (1 or 2 glands or calli sometimes at extreme base)
Leaves 1 or 2; labellum variously fringed, hairy and/or with lamina glands or calli
Leaf very hairy; flower usually solitary, bright mauve or purplish, rarely white; column broadly winged throughout
Leaf glabrous; flowers usually several, greenish-brown or dark red; column almost wingless or winged in upper part only
Leaf heart-shaped, often held well above soil surface, reddish-purple to green beneath, not glistening; perianth segments with fine extension; column very narrowly or not winged
Leaf orbicular, ground-hugging, with light green glistening undersurface; perianth segments not tapering to long fine point; column prominently winged in upper part
Leaves 2; flower solitary, green or reddish-brown; labellum entire, with few to many dark waxy calli
Leaf solitary; flowers often more than 1; labellum tri-lobed, sometimes obscurely so, with many lamina calli, usually in rows
Leaf variously hairy
Leaf glabrous
Perianth segments variously coloured, but not blue or purplish
Perianth segments blue or purplish
Labellum distinctly tri-lobed, lamina with 2 neat rows of calli
Labellum obscurely tri-lobed, lamina with 4–8 rows of congested calli or with many scattered calli
[link through]
Labellum not usually white at base, lacking tall calli at base, lamina with 4–8 rows of congested calli
Labellum often white towards base, lamina with 2 or 4 tall calli at base and many small scattered calli (natural hybrid between Pheladenia and Glossodia)
[link through]
[link through]
Petals and lateral sepals dimorphic; floral bracts small, not exceeding ovaries; column broadly winged; labellum on a moveable claw
Petals and lateral sepals similar in size, shape and colour; floral bracts large, exceeding ovaries; column wings very narrow or rudimentary; labellum sessile
[link through]
Leaf broad-ovate to sub-orbicular, fleshy, ground-hugging; flowers white with prominent red stripes, drying black
Leaf linear-lanceolate, thin-textured, obliquely erect; flowers usually dark brown with red and yellow markings, not drying black
[link through]
[link through]
Plants robust, often up to 1 m tall; flowers usually heavily spotted or blotched; plants not fire-dependant for flowering
Plants slender, <15 cm tall; flowers not spotted or blotched; plants flowering only the season following a fire
[link through]
Leaves thick-textured, ovate or terete; lateral sepals dilated at base and united with column foot to form a chin-like extension; labellum without spur; plants lithophytic
Leaves thin-textured, lanceolate, often falcate; lateral sepals free, not forming chin-like extension; labellum with prominent spur or deep pouch; plants epiphytic
Roots mostly hanging in the air and very long; perianth less than 6 mm long; spur of labellum hollow, with finger-like appendage almost closing orifice
Roots mostly creeping on bark of host; perianth more than 10 mm long; labellum solid, without appendage
[link through]
